title: Fix Seth for Sawtooth 1.1 Consensus
body:
Sawtooth 1.1 Consensus does not work.
The DevMode consensus engine times-out and does not connect
to the validator and times-out.
The solution is to open port 5050 in container devmode-engine-rust.

Signed-off-by: danintel <daniel.anderson@intel.com>

title: Fix Seth for apt-key/gpg Proxy on Bionic
body:
gpg (through "apt-key adv") ignores http_proxy and
https_proxy settings on Bionic.
The solution is to use http with curl instead to download keys.

Signed-off-by: danintel <daniel.anderson@intel.com>

title: Update Seth RPC to use sawtooth-sdk = 0.2
Updating burrow

title: Handle missing global permissions
body:
Handles issue stemming from Burrow's issue #908, where a panic occurs if the global permissions address isn't set.

title: Update Dockerfile
body:
default repository in github.com/hyperledger/burrow is 'developer' not 'master', so there is no folder named github.com/hyperledger/burrow/execution/evm/ and running blow command in Dockerfile fails.
RUN go get -u \
...
github.com/hyperledger/burrow/execution/evm/sha3 \
...

title: Fix Seth build process

A recent Burrow update broke the Go CLI. This moves that CLI to the same fork that the processor has been using. This PR also fixes several Rust-related build process issues.

Newer Dockerfiles contain git clones, which can hang without a tty/stdin available.  Not sure why this doesn't show on hyperledger jenkins, but it doubtless appears in other environments than our own.

title: Fix docker ignore
body: Prior to this change on my system the seth-rpc image seemed to ignore the entire contents of `rpc/src/messages`, causing a build error, as `mod.rs` could not be found. This may only be an issue on docker 18.06.1-ce however, as it doesn't seem to reproduce on Jenkins.

title: Receipt fixes
body: Makes it so that receipts are returned when EVM runtime errors occur (e.g. `REVERT`). Adds missing `status`, `from`, and `to` fields to the transaction receipt.

title: Fix build.rs for breaking protoc-rust change
body:
..Default::default() accesses a now non-public member, whereas
Customize::default() is clearer.

Signed-off-by: Boyd Johnson <bjohnson@bitwise.io>

This PR depends on the sdk pr being merged: https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/pull/1891.

title: Update Burrow and un-vendorize it
body:
Updates Burrow to the latest version and un-vendors the dependency.

There are a few incompatibilies between Seth and the newer version of Burrow, those have been fixed in this fork until we can upstream proper fixes:

https://github.com/knkski/burrow

See these bug reports for more info:

https://github.com/hyperledger/burrow/issues/908
https://github.com/hyperledger/burrow/issues/909

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Update JSON-RPC API according to RFC
body:
Implements RFC changes to JSON-RPC API. RFC in question can be found here:

https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-rfcs/pull/22

title: Remove mut requirement on ValidatorClient
body:
The zmq library we use for sending messages doesn't actually require a mutable reference for sending and replying. This PR changes the `&mut self` references to just `&self`.

Relies on https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/pull/1834 being merged.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Reformat rpc's block.rs
body:
Reformats block.rs for ease of reading comprehension. Moves helper functions to bottom of file, converts comments to doc comments, and adds links to the Ethereum JSON-RPC API documentation for each corresponding JSON-RPC API method. Also groups imports into a single group that `cargo fmt` can sort properly.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Remove RPC FilterManager mutability
body: Because the FilterManager manages itself with interior mutability, references to FilterManager don't need to be `mut`. This PR removes the unnecessary mutability.

title: Add Rust CLI based on JSON-RPC API
body:
Adds a new CLI that talks exclusively to the JSON-RPC API, and moves the old one to `cli-go/`.

Implements several CLI methods that don't yet have a JSON-RPC API equivalent, as this PR was submitted separately to cut down on PR size.

Doesn't include unit tests due to the CLI now being a thin client that proxies off all actual work to the API. Integration tests will be included for the CLI <-> API interactions in the JSON-RPC API follow-up PR.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

This function is not in use, and is causing the builds to fail, so removing it

title: Change default RPC return values
body:
The transaction count and balance should be 0 for non-existent accounts, not null. Additionally, the code should be blank.

See https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/d926bf2c7e3182d694c15829a37a0ca7331cd03c/core/state/statedb.go#L199 for prior art.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Clippy lint fixes
body: This PR goes through each clippy lint and adds a commit that fixes it. Particular attention should be paid to the `mutex_atomic` and `collapsible_if` lint fixes, as those were slightly less trivial than copy/pasting the clippy-suggested replacement like the other lint fixes.

body:
This will enforce that PRs have run `cargo fmt` before they are merged, and prevent formatting drift.

body:
This PR is a followup on #42, and adds an integration test to prevent a regression.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Wait to run tests until rest-api is up
body:
The rest-api service is a bit slow to start up, and if it has not started accepting connections by the time the "go test foo.go" command runs, tests will fail. This PR adds a wrapper script for the tests that waits for the rest api to be up and responsive, then runs them as normal.

For an example failure, see https://build.sawtooth.me/job/Sawtooth-Hyperledger/job/sawtooth-seth/job/PR-39/4/console

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Use reliable keyserver for add-apt-repository
body:
This should prevent the reoccurring "no PGP data found" build error.

Signed-off-by: Richard Berg <rberg@bitwise.io>

title: Skip invalid addresses in contract listing
body:
Fixes [STL-1169](https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/STL-1169).

When a contract is successfully called, the caller account's nonce is incremented, which causes spurious addresses to show up for "seth list {alias}". This PR adds a change to the contract list code that checks that each address it displays is actually valid.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Share key dir between cli and rpc containers
body:
The Seth RPC container relies on keys that were generated by the CLI. Previously, we were generating those keys inside of the RPC container with a CLI call. This PR moves to sharing a key directory between the CLI and RPC containers, with the CLI container generating the keys in that directory.

Remix of #28. This PR punts on the issue of using `SAWTOOTH_HOME` / `SAWTOOTH_KEYS` environment variables as per https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth/pull/28#issuecomment-388647413. It also switches from a `get_data_dir` to a `get_key_dir`, as `get_data_dir` is then otherwise unused apart from `get_key_dir`.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

Decreases the size of the generated images by excluding directories that are unnecessary for running this code inside of Docker. Copied from `.gitignore`.

title: Handle nonce-less account creation
body:
When attempting to grab the nonce associated with an account during account creation, `Client.Get` will return `nil, nil` due to the account not yet existing. This PR updates `Client.LookupAccountNonce` to handle that scenario and default to `0` for the nonce instead.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Show EventType in CLI responses
body:
Fixes STL-699. Go was ignoring the `event_type` JSON field due to the snake cased-name. This PR adds a struct tag that makes Go associate the `EventType` struct field with the `event_type` JSON field.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Update Docker Compose File for `seth-rpc` Service
body:
## WHY

The `seth-rpc` service was failing to start due to the first portion of the command in the docker-compose file. This was causing the `curl` commands to fail.

## WHAT

Removing the `seth init` call with compose already running allowed the curl commands to complete as expected when following the developer guides.

title: Add proxy support for docker-compose and Dockerfiles
Remove CLI call and share key dir
body:
- A Seth CLI call was not removed from a Docker Compose command when Seth CLI functionality was removed from the RPC container, which caused a bug when running the Docker Compose file. This PR removes that command

- The  Seth CLI uses `~/.sawtooth/keys` as the default key dir, while the Seth JSON RPC previously used `~/.sawtooth`. This PR updates the RPC to use the keys dir so that the keys can be shared between the components

- Adds a mounted volume to share keys between the seth client and RPC. This way we do not need Seth CLI functionality in the RPC container

body: Adds an "installed" Dockerfile for each component which builds deb files

title: Create initial MAINTAINERS list
body:
This list is intended to recognize current contributors to the
sawtooth-seth repository who have:

- Been actively involved for a substantial amount of time
- Made significant contributions that have been critical to the success
  of the project
- Frequently reviewed pull requests and left thoughtful and
  constructive feedback

To come up with this list objectively, I had to use some git-fu as the repo
also contains a lot of commits from sawtooth-core, so GitHub insights was not
sufficient.

I started by counting all commits in the repository that touched either
`families/burrow_evm` or `families/seth` in core before the commit where the
component was moved out of core, which was
f6fb1bd80e12f668d9d9e70e6150b3db7ad6f7f6

To accomplish this, I did:

    git log -- families/burrow_evm families/seth | grep Author | awk '{ print $2 }' | sort | uniq -c | sort -r

The cutoff commit was on `Thu Nov 16 15:14:54 2017 -0600`.

After this point, commits to the repo only contained commits to sawtooth-seth
(no sawtooth-core) so I was able to use GitHub insights from that date to the
present. That list can be found here:

https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth/graphs/contributors?from=2017-11-17&to=2018-03-29&type=c

I merged the commit counts from these two lists and took all the names that had
more than 10 commits.

The list has been sorted by first name.

Signed-off-by: Adam Ludvik <ludvik@bitwise.io>

title: Fix jenkinsfile
body:
This PR fixes the Jenkinsfile build method/paths and a couple other small bugs that caused the Jenkins build to fail.

Some steps and tests have been removed for the time being, but should be re-enabled as features get fixed: 

- Currently the Seth RPC test fails due to this bug: https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/STL-1124. The test has been commented out for the time being, but a PR fixing that bug should re-enable it.

- The Git archive step should be re-enabled when we do a tagged release

- The docs build step should be re-enabled when we update the documentation build process

title: Adds a build_all script to create the Docker images for Seth
Improve contract compile/deployment workflow
body:
- Links the new `sawtooth-seth/contracts` directory to `/project/sawtooth-seth/contracts` in the seth-cli container, so any files in this directory will be visible and editable on both the host and inside the container. The purpose is to allow a user to create and edit contracts on the host and compile them while inside the container using the installed compilation and abi generation tools. Example contracts are included in the repo at `sawtooth-seth/contracts/examples`.

- Fixes a bug where `ethereumjs-abi` and `web3` were not able to be used from `/project/sawtooth-seth/` using the node cli. This was because the node packages were getting installed to the wrong directory.

- Includes the `solc` compiler in the sawtooth-seth-cli image

title: Reorganize repo and update build workflow
body:
The sawtooth-seth repo was separated from master by deleting out all non-Seth related documents and files. This has led to a disorganized and confusing directory structure. In order to give Seth a good user story and development workflow, this PR reorganizes the repo and simplifies the build process for development.

In order to build and run Seth, just run`docker-compose up --build`. This will build images and start up containers for all Seth components:
- Seth CLI
- Seth TP
- Block info TP
- Settings TP
- Sawtooth REST API
- Sawtooth Validator
- Seth JSON RPC

In order to accomplish this, the following steps were taken:
- Create new Dockerfiles for each Seth component
    - These Dockerfiles will import Sawtooth 1.0 dependencies instead of cloning in
      the whole repo
- Update docker-compose.yaml to build an image for each component and
  run the containers
- Update imports in .go files and Cargo.toml to correct dependencies

_Note: The Sawtooth Go SDK being used is an unofficial repo hosted at https://github.com/rberg2/sawtooth-go-sdk. Once there is an official hyperledger/sawtooth-sdk-go repo, we should switch to that._

body: Signed-off-by: Adam Ludvik <ludvik@bitwise.io>

title: Fixes the Dockerfiles for Seth development builds
body: Updates to the documentation at the start of the Seth Dockerfiles, showing build and run commands.

title: Update various Ethereum RPC methods
body:
- Adds `QUANTITY|TAG` support for the `eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber`,
`eth_getBlockByNumber` and `eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex` methods and implements the `full` boolean for return complete transaction details.
- Adds an `eth_syncing` method that always returns false.
- Add a `net_peerCount` method that return the total number of validator peers in the network.

title: Only use 20 bytes of contract address in receipts
body: The contract addresses used in the Ethereum RPC interface should only be 20 bytes long, so remove the leading bytes which are `00` anyway.

title: Fix account nonce usage in RPC interface
body: Set the account nonce to the correct value when creating transactions, to allow clients like Truffle to work properly. Also changes the type to `uint64` to match other occurrences and makes `GetStorage` return 0 for initial accesses to  location, as per EVM spec for `SLOAD`.

title: Update to getting started documentation
body: Fixes the Docker Compose file to reference the Hyperledger 1.0.1 images  and start the Seth RPC server as well as correct various minor issues in it, and updates the getting started documentation with the correct commands to build and use Seth with this file.
